description: Building distributed systems with Spring Cloud.

slides.title: Monolith vs Microservices üèõÔ∏è
slides.content:
# One vs Many

- **Monolith:** One giant app (WAR file). Simple to deploy but hard to scale parts.
- **Microservices:** Many small services communicating via APIs. Complex to manage but easy to scale independently.

slides.title: Spring Cloud ‚òÅÔ∏è
slides.content:
# The Toolbox

A framework built on top of Spring Boot to handle common distributed system patterns:
- Service Discovery
- Config Management
- Circuit Breakers
- API Gateway

slides.title: Service Discovery
slides.content:
# Who are you? üîç

In a dynamic cloud, IP addresses change.

**Eureka Server:** A phonebook where services register themselves.

Services ask Eureka: "Where is the Payment Service?" instead of hardcoding IPs.

slides.title: Config Server
slides.content:
# Central Config üóÉÔ∏è

Manage configurations for ALL services in one Git repository.

Services fetch their config from the **Config Server** at startup.

Change config in Git -> Refresh services live.

slides.title: Types of Communication
slides.content:
# Talking üó£Ô∏è

- **Synchronous:** REST Template / Feign Client (I wait for you to answer).
- **Asynchronous:** Kafka / RabbitMQ (I send a message and forget, you process it later).

slides.title: Architecture Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which component acts as the 'phonebook' for service locations in Spring Cloud?

slides.title: API Gateway
slides.content:
# The Doorman üö™

**Spring Cloud Gateway**.

Single entry point for all clients.

Handles routing, security, rate limiting, and analytics before forwarding requests to internal services.

slides.title: Feign Client
slides.content:
# Declarative REST üìú

Instead of writing `RestTemplate` boilerplate.

Define an interface:
`@GetMapping("/users/{id}") User getUser(@PathVariable Long id);`

Spring implements it automatically.

slides.title: Circuit Breaker
slides.content:
# Resilience ‚ö°

**Resilience4j**.

If the 'Payment Service' is down, stop calling it to prevent cascading failures.

Open the circuit -> Return fallback/cached response -> Retry later.

slides.title: Distributed Tracing
slides.content:
# Detective Work üïµÔ∏è

**Zipkin** and **Sleuth** (Micrometer Tracing).

Assigns a Trace ID to a request so you can track its journey across 10 different microservices logs.

slides.title: Saga Pattern
slides.content:
# Distributed Transactions ü§ù

Transactions across multiple services are hard.

Saga = Sequence of local transactions.

If one fails, execute compensating transactions (undo steps) to rollback.

slides.title: Reliability Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What pattern prevents a failure in one service from crashing the entire system?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Microservices ‚òÅÔ∏è

Distributed power.

- **Eureka:** Discovery.
- **Gateway:** Entry.
- **Config:** Centralized.
- **Circuit Breaker:** Resilience.
- **Tracing:** Debugging.
